Hi everyone, I'm trying to update the heading font - it's appearing in the preview below, but doesn't repsond to mobile (or any other email clients). Can someone help me out with this? I'm also trying to make the social widgets smaller (and preferrably in our company's preferred pantones).
This is the mobile preview:
The font looks custom, which some clients are going to ignore - you'd need to check the support of custom fonts in the browsers you are targeting
<https://litmus.com/blog/the-ultimate-guide-to-web-fonts>
in terms of changing the social icons colours, generally icons in emails are images so you'd need to edit the image outside of HubSpot and then upload and link to the new images
Best of luck, emails are a nightmare

As Joel said - custom fonts are completely ignored in a lot of email clients. Because of this I avoid them alltogether because all of the styling intended for the original font will affect the fallback font, and that can look stupid.

In your case I’d set your fallback font to comic sans, wont look the same but it’s probably the closest web safe font to that font.
Thanks Joel and Jon - I'll give it a go! Can I set my fallback font in the email body module or should this be done in the stylesheet?
you either do it as an inline style or do it in your head styles. oh and btw external stylesheets can’t be used in emails. most email clients don’t support that
best as inline code, emails don't use stylesheets. You can put it in the head of the email in the style tag and I believe HubSpot will inline it
jynx
haha
Okay - I'll give it a go!
I should make an intro to html emails course. The first lesson in the course will be titled “Welcome to hell”
Yeah - it is really the bane of my existence. Always 1 step forward and about 25 steps backwards
Just convince client that plain text email is the way to fo
Done and done
Fax is also a winning option
lol we were doing that for a while, plain text is definitely good for open rates
And so quick to download!
I speak for the people who have bandwidth caps
lol

Running into a strange issue where modules are disappearing from their folders in the file explorer in the Design Manager, but if I use the "Search Assets" search box it finds them. Anyone seen this before? Right before it happened it was also strange I clicked on *File* and the options were *New file in null* and *New folder in null*
yea mine disappear from folders but end up in the root
<@UEZ3125LL> <@U26AKMZ19> did you ever find out anything here?

ah, mine aren't in root. There's two that I know of missing. I've checked every single folder and they don't exist anywhere. But they appear if I search for them (which doesn't tell me where they are).
Hmm I don't know then, they aren't deleted are they?
no. If I find them in search and click on them, they open up as normal. Also I can still add the modules to templates just fine. They just ghosted me in the file explorer sidepanel.
